snippet: Many of the gains came at Toyota and Honda, the two big Japanese manufacturers that suffered major product shortages after last year’s earthquake and tsunami in Japan.
abstract: Research firm Autodata reports that auto sales in September were at the highest rate in four years with a total of 1.19 million cars, trucks and SUVs sold in the United States during the month, a 13 percent increase from a year earlier; Japanese and German manufacturers led the sales boom, offsetting weaker results at General Motors and Ford.
lead_paragraph: Many of the gains came at Toyota and Honda, the two big Japanese manufacturers that suffered major product shortages after last year’s earthquake and tsunami in Japan.

headline.seo: Auto Sales Are the Highest in 4 Years
headline.main: Auto Sales Are Highest in 4 Years
headline.print_headline: Auto Sales Are Highest In 4 Years
